column4: i have a question, when i charge my laptop batter and when its done, i unplug it and it always says "Battery Discharging" ... what does this mean?
is there anything i should install to help protect my battery from overcharging or anything? for ubuntu
or out of the box ubuntu should work?
should be fine
you mean you want to change the way ubuntu is distributed?
yeah
depends /how/ you installed it.  Usually, you have to read the documentation.
i installed thunderbird with ..
i used this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1379961
follow the directions in reverse
wont
I don't mean literally.  I mean read what you did and undo it
hint: you copied files to some directory, then you created a menu item for it.  So undo those two things....
adding a key to your apt keyring.  Basically, you're telling apt to trust software that's signed with that key
im attempting to install mongodb .. im not sure if i should trust the software though .. lol
isn't mongodb in the default repositories?
same way you installed them.  Use System -> Administration -> Additional Drivers
schnuffle that worked thanks :)
only thing to note is that if you have files with the same name, they will be overwritten
yeah i do, i probably have hundreds, it is what it is though
